paw_structure.utility¶

Error and input handling.

Dependencies:

argparse sys time

argcheck(argv, extension)

Checks console input and arguments.

err(func, id, arg[, info])

Raise specific errors for internal checks.

err_file(func, path)

Terminate program if error during file opening.

structure_ion_input()

Get console input for structure_ion.

structure_radial_input()

Get console input for structure_radial.

structure_water_input()

Get console input for structure_ion.

timing(f)

Time of execution for a function.
paw_structure.utility.argcheck(argv, extension)¶

Checks console input and arguments.

Parameters

  • argv (list[str]) – two element list with arguments being extracted with sys.argv()

  • extension (str) – expected extension of second argument (e.g. ‘.ion’, ‘.water’, ‘.hbonds’)

Returns

name with extension removed

Return type

str

Calls utility.err() in case of wrong input.

paw_structure.utility.err(func, id, arg, info='')¶

Raise specific errors for internal checks.

With func and id a dictionary of error functions is accessed.

Parameters

  • func (str) – name of function in which error occured

  • id (int) – number of dictionary entry for function func

  • arg (list) – list of arguments specific for each error (can vary in length and type)

  • info (str, optional) – text displayed in error message

Returns

sys.exit() displaying an error message

paw_structure.utility.err_file(func, path)¶

Terminate program if error during file opening.

Parameters

  • func (str) – name of function in which error occured

  • path (str) – path of file where opening failed

Returns

sys.exit() displaying an error message:

PROGRAM TERMINATED
ERROR IN FUNCTION: <func>

COULD NOT OPEN FILE
<path>

paw_structure.utility.structure_ion_input()¶

Get console input for structure_ion.

Returns

argparse object

paw_structure.utility.structure_radial_input()¶

Get console input for structure_radial.

Returns

argparse object

paw_structure.utility.structure_water_input()¶

Get console input for structure_ion.

Returns

argparse object

paw_structure.utility.timing(f)¶

Time of execution for a function.

Use as decorator:

@timing
def function():
    #code
